settings.title: People with chronic illnesses feel invisible.
settings.subtitle: Buoy‚Äôs first campaign spotlights four creators upending chronic illness culture on TikTok by helping those fighting silent battles To Be Seen.
settings.text: From friends and family to social media algorithms and healthcare professionals, chronic illnesses chronically go unseen and unheard.

settings.text1: From Eating Disorder Recovery to Lyme Disease and POTS, chronic illnesses can feel like they swallow your identity.
settings.text2:
Help us reshape chronic illness culture, even if you aren't living with a chronic condition.

Share your story on TikTok with #ToBeSeen.

settings.title: Sugar
settings.subtitle: Found in: Gatorade, Liquid IV, Nuun
settings.text: Not only does sugar cause inflammation and disease, it can also make you more dehydrated. Sugar intake can work against electrolyte function.

settings.title: Stevia
settings.subtitle: Found In: Ultima, LMNT, Nuun
settings.text: Not only does sugar cause inflammation and disease, it can also make you more dehydrated. Sugar intake can work against electrolyte function.

settings.title: Dextrose
settings.subtitle: Found In: Gatorade, Liquid IV, Nuun
settings.text: A simple sugar derived from corn, dextrose consumption causes fluid build up, spikes in blood pressure and excessive thirst.

settings.title: Natural Flavors
settings.subtitle: Found In: Liquid IV, Nuun
settings.text: The FDA allows any food additive originating in nature to be labeled as a Natural Flavor, meaning sketchy solvents and preservatives like BHA and  propylene glycol are basically perfumes for your mouth. Vanilla and Strawberry originate from compounds in beaver anal and sexual glands.

settings.title: Bad Form Factors
settings.text: Not only does sugar cause inflammation and disease, it can also make you more dehydrated. Sugar intake can work against electrolyte function.

settings.title: Artificial Ingredients
settings.text: There‚Äôs a laundry list of ingredients from dyes, oils, chemical alternatives to electrolytes, blending and bleaching agents and artificial ingredients added in for taste that you can find in natural grocery markets.

settings.title: Why Buoy?
settings.text:
Hydration supplements are one of the first things healthcare professionals recommend for managing chronic conditions.

Unfortunately, powders, tablets and sports drinks use dodgy ingredients that exacerbate health issues.

settings.title: Get 35% Off
settings.text: For those with chronic illnesses looking for clean hydration, get Buoy‚Äôs lifetime 35% off discount with our Chronic Illness Support Program. Apply for the program in two minutes.

settings.title: Donations to Nonprofits
settings.text: We donate a bottle for every bottle sold on our website to a verified 501(c)3 nonprofit supporting chronic illness communities. If you don‚Äôt have an illness, you can still support those who do.

settings.title: Chronic Illness Creators
settings.text: For Summer 22, we‚Äôre investing only in creators with chronic conditions. These talented creators are often tokenized, unpaid and under-represented and it‚Äôs time they got their bag.

settings.title: Thank you. I‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts.
settings.text:
Creating this campaign is the single most rewarding aspect of founding Buoy. I worked with four creators pushing our culture forward. I watched Stew Caldwell and Apphia Castillo redefine brand storytelling with their creative firm Round Two Agency. And I finally celebrated Buoy and our founding team‚Äôs core value of giving back that‚Äôs been a north start for us since day one.

I‚Äôd love it if you share this campaign with friends, family and coworkers. Every voice counts.
